Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on his friendship with a thief called Musashi, the film takes place at the beginning of the Showa period when Japan, and Miyazawa with it, faced the dilemma of rebirth and the will for a brighter future amidst socio-political issues and business developments that dominated the society of the time.<|end_of_text|>

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat-loving witch (Debbieloff Young), a revenge-seeking priest (Ken Hicks) and an accidental murder.
